description: A mobile-first application designed to help users take full control of their financial obligations. Built with React Native and Expo, it provides a comprehensive solution for managing subscriptions, bills, insurance renewals, and recurring expenses — all in one place.

overview.purpose: Life Admin which is a Personal Finance & Renewal Tracker focuses specifically on renewal cycles and deadline awareness. It combines smart reminders, detailed analytics, secure local storage, and a guided multi-step entry flow to ensure users never miss a payment or renewal date again.
targetUsers: Individuals managing multiple subscriptions and recurring bills
Users who want proactive payment reminders
People who prefer offline-first, privacy-focused financial tools
Anyone tracking insurance renewals, rent cycles, or utility bills
benefits: Renewal-First: Built around recurring cycles — subscriptions, insurance, rent, and bills
Smart Reminders: Automated alerts at 30, 7, 3, and 1 day before every due date
Offline-First: Works entirely on-device with optional cloud sync. No internet required
Secure: Privacy-first design with encrypted local storage and biometric app lock
Insightful: Analytics dashboard with monthly breakdowns and category-level spending insights

problem.summary: Most people manage dozens of recurring financial obligations — monthly subscriptions, annual insurance renewals, quarterly bills, and rent cycles. Without a dedicated system, these deadlines live scattered across emails, paper documents, and memory. The result: missed renewals, unexpected charges, and unnecessary late fees.
painPoints: Missed Payments: No centralized system to track upcoming due dates leads to forgotten renewals and avoidable penalties.
Manual Reminders: Calendar reminders are static and require manual setup for every renewal — unsustainable at scale.
Scattered Records: Bills, receipts, and renewal documents exist in different apps, folders, and inboxes with no unified view.
Lack of Insight: Without analytics, users cannot identify spending patterns or anticipate high-expense months in advance.

points: Supports monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, and annual cycles
Visual status cards with color-coded urgency indicators
Active status tracking with archived record support
Category-based organization (Health, Vehicle, General, Utilities, Insurance, Rent)

Badge count reflects total pending reminders

workflow.title: Create a Record
workflow.description: Tap the central '+' tab in bottom navigation. Fill in title, category chip, and amount in Step 1 of the wizard.

workflow.title: Set Renewal Cycle
workflow.description: In Step 2, pick a due date from the calendar picker and select a repeat cycle (No Repeat, Monthly, Every 3 Months, Every 6 Months, or Yearly). The system auto-calculates the next due date.

workflow.title: Enable Reminders
workflow.description: In Step 3, toggle on reminder intervals (30-day, 7-day, 3-day, 1-day) individually. Add optional notes for payment instructions or account references.

workflow.title: Confirm & Save
workflow.description: Review the live preview card. Tap Confirm & Save — the record is written to AsyncStorage and notifications are scheduled immediately.

workflow.title: Log Expense
workflow.description: When a payment is made, open the record detail view and log an expense. Enter amount, select payment method, optionally attach a receipt.

workflow.title: Track Analytics
workflow.description: Navigate to the Analytics tab to view monthly totals, category breakdowns, and 6-month spending history. Data updates in real time.

workflow.title: Export Report
workflow.description: At month-end, go to Settings and tap Export to PDF. A structured report of all records and expenses is generated and shared via the native share sheet.

metrics: Monthly Total: Aggregate of all expense logs within the current calendar month
Category Split: Per-category spend as percentage and absolute value for selected period
Upcoming Load: Total amount due in the next 30 days across all active records
History View: Month-by-month historical data with month selector for trend analysis
Month-over-Month Change: Percentage increase or decrease vs previous month
visuals: Horizontal bar chart comparing last 6 months of total expense
Progress bars for category distribution (Health, Vehicle, Utilities, General, Other)
Color-coded due date indicators: red (overdue), orange (within 7 days), green (upcoming)
Upcoming vs paid card for current month summary
analytics.logic: All analytics are computed client-side from AsyncStorage data using Context API selectors. No external analytics service is used. Data is filtered by calendar month boundaries and aggregated per category using reduce operations.

architecture.frontend: React Native with Expo SDK — single codebase targeting iOS and Android. Screens organized by feature module. Styling via StyleSheet API with NativeWind utility classes.
architecture.backend: No dedicated backend server. Optional Firebase Firestore for cloud sync (user opt-in). Firebase Auth for account management when cloud features are enabled.
architecture.state: Context API with useReducer — RecordsContext, ExpenseContext, ThemeContext, and AuthContext wrap the app root. Lightweight global state without Redux overhead.
architecture.storage: AsyncStorage for records and expense logs. Expo SecureStore for credentials, PIN, and sensitive configuration. All data stored locally on device by default.
architecture.api: Expo Notifications API for local push scheduling. Expo LocalAuthentication for biometric/PIN lock. react-native-html-to-pdf for PDF generation. Optional Firebase SDK for cloud sync.

security.authentication: Biometric authentication (Face ID / Fingerprint) via Expo LocalAuthentication. PIN fallback stored in Expo SecureStore. Auto-lock after 5 minutes of inactivity. Three failed attempts triggers 30-second lockout.
security.encryption: Expo SecureStore provides OS-level encrypted storage for credentials and PIN. AsyncStorage data is stored in app-sandboxed local storage inaccessible to other apps.
security.privacy: No analytics or telemetry collected. No third-party tracking SDKs. All data stored on-device by default. Cloud sync is purely opt-in and user-controlled. No data shared with external services.

principles: Card-based layout — every record and expense lives in a clean, tappable card
Bottom navigation — thumb-friendly access to all primary modules
Step-based forms — guided entry reduces cognitive load and input errors
Color-coded urgency — immediate visual understanding of payment status
System font usage — native feel on both iOS (SF Pro) and Android (Roboto)
Responsive spacing — dynamic padding adapts to device size and safe areas
patterns: RecordCard: title, category badge, amount, due date, repeat icon
ExpenseItem: method icon, amount, date, expandable receipt view
CategoryChip: colored pill selector for Health / Vehicle / General / Utilities
StepIndicator: progress dots for multi-step form navigation
ReminderToggle: labeled switch for each notification interval
AmountInput: currency-prefixed numeric field with native keyboard
StatusBadge: active / archived / overdue state indicator

features: Phase 2 (Q3 2025): Firebase cloud sync (opt-in), multi-device login, enhanced PDF reports with charts, recurring expense templates
Phase 3 (Q1 2026): AI-powered spending insights, monthly budget planning module, web dashboard companion app, multi-language and currency support
AI Insights: Anomaly detection, subscription audit for inactive subscriptions, 3-month budget recommendations, renewal cost predictions
Budget Planning: Per-category monthly budget limits, real-time progress bars, overspend alerts, annual cost projection from renewal cycles
Cross-Platform: Web dashboard companion for desktop access, data portability across platforms
future.roadmap: The current build establishes a solid offline-first foundation. Phase 2 focuses on connectivity and collaboration. Phase 3 introduces intelligence and platform expansion. All enhancements preserve the app's core simplicity and privacy-first approach.
